title: Everyday English Course 103
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: When will the bank open on Sundays?

questionTemplates.text:
W: You are early today! Did you drive here?
M: That's my last choice. Driving a car in rush hour is obviously not a good idea.
W: So you took a bus?
M: No, the subway instead. I found it the easiest and cheapest way for me to get to the office.
{a}

variables.a: How did the man get to the office today?

answerOptions: The blue shoes are more expensive.
The black shoes are more expensive.
instances.correctAnswer: The black shoes are more expensive.

questionTemplates.text:
M: Good afternoon, Mrs. Green. How's your arm?
W: Oh, it's all right. I've already forgotten about it! It's my neck that hurts! Look, doctor! I can't turn my head!
M: Let's have a look. Sit down over here, please.
{a}

variables.a: Which part of the woman's body hurts?

answerOptions: She can translate it into French.
instances.correctAnswer: She can translate it into French.

questionTemplates.text:
W: You've had a part-time job, haven't you?
M: Yes, I have.
W: Could you earn a lot of money?
M: No, only a little.
W: Would you like to work this summer to make some extra money?
M: I think so.
{a}

answerOptions: He won't earn a little money.
